answerText: corona[10] Coronal loops are loops of twisted magnetic flux that terminate on these features on the photosphere, which exhibit intense magnetic activity and lower-than-normal temperatures, and have cycles of varying activity lasting about eleven years.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Michigan A, MIT A | 9 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Identify this layer of the sun which reaches temperatures of one to three millions of kelvin, despite lying atop a layer that exists at 5800 kelvins.
